modules.description: Represents positions in a Gherkin file using line and column numbers. Provides conversion to string for display and parsing from command-line arguments to initialize default positions. Used to track where tags or features are defined in source files.

Produces a string representation of a doc string and applies a function to its content. Works with a custom type encapsulating textual data. Used to process and extract information from structured text in test scenarios.

Converts a data table to a string, maps rows to key-value structures, and applies custom transformations to rows. Operates on tabular data structured as lists of strings, with headers defining column or row keys. Enables processing of structured test data, such as mapping user attributes from a table or transforming rows into custom formats.

Provides functions to convert step data to strings, match steps against regular expressions, and extract captured groups or arguments. Works with step text and argument structures derived from Cucumber syntax. Used to process and validate step definitions during test execution.

Provides functions to convert outcome values to strings, count specific outcome types in a list, and determine an exit status based on the presence of non-pass outcomes. Works with a custom type representing test or run step results, including values like Pass, Fail, Pending, Undefined, and Skip. Used to generate summary reports and determine process exit codes in testing or validation workflows.

Provides functions to convert tags to strings, compare tags for equality, and parse a string into lists of allowed and disallowed tags. Works with the `t` type representing individual tags. Used to filter scenarios based on command-line tag arguments during test execution.

Loads Gherkin feature files and returns Pickle data structures. Processes and retrieves steps, names, and tagged filters for scenario execution. Executes custom hooks before and after Pickle processing.

Generates a structured textual report from a list of outcome data, organizing information into readable sections. It processes nested lists of outcome records and applies formatting rules for display. Used to present validation results or test summaries in a user-friendly manner.

Provides functions to convert a dialect identifier to its corresponding language string. Works with an opaque type representing supported language dialects. Used to dynamically select and display Gherkin keywords in the appropriate language during test execution.

Provides functions to define and execute Cucumber step definitions using regular expressions, attach hooks for pre- and post-step actions, and manage execution flow with outcome states. Operates on a parameterized context type that holds state and step definition logic. Used to build and run test scenarios by linking regex patterns to executable code and controlling test execution based on defined steps.

Parses Gherkin feature files into structured data, extracts scenarios and steps, and supports executing step definitions against parsed features. Works with abstract syntax trees, scenario outlines, and step definitions. Enables test automation by mapping natural language steps to OCaml implementations.

Manages Gherkin file elements by tracking positions, processing doc strings, and handling data tables, steps, and outcomes. It supports tag filtering, language dialect conversion, and generates structured reports from test results. Functions include parsing, transforming, and validating test data, as well as executing step definitions with custom hooks. It enables detailed control over test execution, from loading feature files to producing formatted summaries.
